question: Question_10
statement:
Let \emph{A\textsuperscript{H} = -A} be a skew-Hermitian complex matrix.
Show that the matrix \emph{e\textsuperscript{At}} is unitary.

\emph{Note:} The superscript \emph{H} denotes the
\href{http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conjugate_transpose}{Hermitian
conjugate} $(\mathbf{A}^H)_{ij} = \overline{\mathbf{A}_{ji}}$, which is
often also called \emph{adjoint matrix} or \emph{conjugate transpose}
and written as \emph{A\textsuperscript{*} = A\textsuperscript{H}}.
hints:
In order for \emph{e\textsuperscript{At}} to be unitary, we need
$\left(e^{At}\right)^{H} e^{At} = I.$
